DR H J GLEN and PROF A D B POOLE, Nineteenth-Century Graduate Seminar (2S, 2 hours, odd weeks) Tu. 4.30, English Board Room
2 May (Note change of day and venue) Dr Robert Douglas-Fairhurst (Madgalen College, Oxford): The Lady Vanishes: Magic and Metamorphosis in Victorian Literature (in the English Faculty, S-R24)
15 May Andrew Francis (Trinity): 'In the Way of Business': Commerce and Love in Joseph Conrad's 'A Smile of Fortune:Harbour Story.''

The story of 25,000 words was first published in 1911 in the London Magazine and in book form in 1912 in 'Twixt Land and Sea: Three Tales'. An online text is available at www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext97/twxls10.txt

column2: 2006 Faculty of English, University of Cambridge
